name: Gatte Ki Sabzi
history: Originating from Rajasthan, Gatte Ki Sabzi is a beloved dish in Indian cuisine, known for its use of gram flour dumplings in a flavorful yogurt-based gravy.
description: Gatte Ki Sabzi is a delicious curry made from gram flour (besan) dumplings, cooked in a tangy and spicy yogurt gravy. It's a staple in Rajasthani meals, often served with rice or roti.

instructions.title: Prepare Gatte
instructions.description: Mix gram flour, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, salt, and a little ghee or oil. Add yogurt and knead into a stiff dough. Form the dough into cylindrical shapes, boil in water until they float to the top, and then cut into bite-sized pieces.

instructions.title: Make the Curry
instructions.description: Heat ghee in a pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. Once they splutter, add the prepared gatte, water, and additional spices. Cook until the gravy thickens.

instructions.title: Finalize and Serve
instructions.description: Once the gatte are cooked and the gravy has reached the desired consistency, garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve hot with rice or roti.

tips: The dough for gatte should be stiff and not too soft.
Adjust the amount of water in the curry as per the desired consistency.
variations: Add chopped onions and tomatoes to the curry for extra flavor.
Experiment with different spices like garam masala or amchur (dry mango powder) for a variation in taste.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container and reheat before serving.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until warm.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish, garnished with cilantro.
Pair with Indian bread like chapati or naan for a complete meal.
